column5: It,s been a long dry spell for me this spring.The last fish I caught was a 2 pound rainbow back in early March. Not sure if I was doing something wrong,or I just didnt adapted to the weird weather we have been having. Blown rivers,high waters,cold for a week,then the +20 temps for a week. I,ll tell ya,I was getting depressed. Well not really,but it was getting frustrating. Yesterday I was out on the Notty (told there was lots of fish) HAHAHAHAHAHA,get yer turkey yet bud?  Atleast I got my feed a fiddel heads.    So for todays outing,Im trying to decide,what,where,how,to fish  Do I hit the notty for one more try,or do I go with the fly and streams? Well I decided to give the notty a try. I went,I saw,and after a couple of hours,I left. It,s only 7:30 plenty of time to try another spot. I had my 5 wt in the trunk,so headed to a nice stream.  As Im walking down to it,the bugs are crazy. In my ears,up my nose,in my eyes. Then it dawned on me,,,,,,,,,,,,,theres a hatch going on.SWEET.  I watch to see what they are. They look like black flys,but their not. Then I see a few larger ones,and get an idea of what I can try.  Not sure if you can see them flying around.      So I start throwing this little fly for about 10 minutes,with nothing to show. I was really watching the water for action,but there was no fish surfacing. Then it happen,yup,back swing,and catch me a nice tall pine.   Pull and I lose it.  I remember a post  about late spring fishing,and it felt like it was today,with the warm weather and the water wasnt really that cold. So I go through my inventory and find me a #14 halgimiight.(sp)  I try a nice ripple area that goes into a nice pool. First swing,lands just nice. It makes it way down and hits the slack water WHAM. I lift,and the short fight is on. A few nice jumps and it was on the bank.  PB on a fly. A nice resident rainbow.Quick pic,and off he was, back to his play ground.       Long post for a small fish,but I havent made a fishing related post in sometime.  OH WHAT A RELIEF IT IS.  My names not Terry any more.
well thats just mean   lol   I did alright from the boat too which ran real well....just in time to sell it
Beauty and always a great feeling watching a fly getting nailed on a drift into a pool ain't it ?
At least you got that monkey of your back lol. Nice fish!
right on. Washed my white stripe off today too. First slime in the boat for 2013.
Ah you got big shoulders,you can take it.LOL   Sure is.    My back feels much better Dave. Thanks   Thats how you lift the blues brother.  Way to go.
Great job Brian   Must be my lucky day too... got a couple of beauts this morning
Is yer daytime light before or after me? LOL  Good job me friend.
Hahahahha , no turkey yet. Arms are to sore to steady a shotgun !! To many fish ;-)
You should try black flies Brian, they're in season! Nice Fish BTW.  RobC
Excellent work I love resident rainbows. Wish we could dedicate a stream to them somewhere.
Well 1 fish is better than none is right  Nice going B
And that ^ is what happens when a 13 month old can just reach the side of the laptop.
Good feeling fish on a fly Brian.  WTG dood!  And ummmm... mouth watering for some greens here man.
Goos stuff brian. Looks. Like a great day.  Fresh trout and fiddleheads,, a sure sign of spring  S
Nice fish Brian! looks like a blast. I think the fly you were trying to spell was perhaps a hellgrammite?
